contentList.content: Debug: BOOST Aura of Artificer - Passive (Technical)
Debug: BOOST Aura of Artificer - Passive
Debug: Passive Aura of Artificer - Technical
Debug: Passive Aura of Artificer - Passive (Technical) - Self

Masters of invention, artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.
You gain Proficiency and Expertise in Sleight of Hand checks.
Levels in Artificer will give extra Spell Slots compared to other half-casters when multiclassing.

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.
A red elixir, producing a warm light.
The drinker regains a hit points.
A green elixir, producing flickering light.
A purple elixir, producing a comforting light.
The drinker gains a bonus to AC.
A pink elixir, producing a confident light.
The drinker gets a temporary bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
A blue elixir, producing a dreamy light.
The drinker can fly for a limited period.

You can magically produce experimental elixirs with random effects. The number you can make per Long Rest increases with your level in the class. You can create additional experimental elixirs by expending a Spell Slot.
The elixirs that are not consumed disappear after a Long Rest.
Produce one of your daily elixirs.
Produce an elixir consuming a Spell Slot.

You've developed masterful command of magical chemicals, enhancing the healing and damage you create through them. Whenever you cast a spell using your alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell. That roll must restore hit points or be a damage roll that deals acid, fire, necrotic, or poison damage, and the bonus equals your Intelligence modifier (minimum of +1).

You have learned to incorporate restorative reagents into some of your works: whenever a creature drinks an experimental elixir you created, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to 2d6. You can cast Lesser Restoration without expending a Spell Slot and without preparing the spell.
You learned how to use your alchemy replicate some magic ingredients from basic elements. You can expend Salvaged Elements to create a wide variety of base components for Alchemy recipes.
You've learned to magically produce Experimental Elixirs. These have a random effect and lasts until a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>
You can cast Lesser Restoration without expending a Spell Slot and without preparing the spell a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier (minimum of once)

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

An artificer who specializes as an Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin. The armor is enhanced to hone the artificer's magic, unleash potent attacks, and generate a formidable defense. The artificer bonds with this armor, becoming one with it even as they experiment with it and refine its magical capabilities.

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield. This destructive power is valued by armies in the wars on many different worlds. And when war passes, some members of this specialization seek to build a more peaceful world by using their powers to fight the resurgence of strife.

You've learned how to create a magical cannon. Using woodcarver's tools or smith's tools, you can take an action to magically create a Small or Tiny eldritch cannon in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you. A Small eldritch cannon occupies its space, and a Tiny one can be held in one hand.

The cannon exhales fire in an adjacent cone that you designate. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> against your spell save <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DC</LSTag>, taking 2d8 fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.
Make a ranged spell attack, originating from the cannon, at one creature or object within range. On a hit, the target takes damage and is pushed up to away from the cannon.
The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice a number of temporary hit points.
You know how to turn a wand, staff, or rod into an arcane firearm, a conduit for your destructive spells. When you cast a spell, you can add 1d8 to one damage roll.

The cannon's damage rolls all increase by 1d8. You can command the cannon to detonate. Doing so destroys the cannon and forces each creature in range to make a Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Orders the cannon to eject all stored energy into a violent explosion. Involved creatures must succeed a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> to avoid taking full damage.

You always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both materiel and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are accompanied by a Steel Defender, a protective companion of their own creation. Many soldiers tell stories of nearly dying before being saved by a Battle Smith and a Steel Defender.
This companion's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and damage increase with the <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> of its artificer.
Your tinkering has borne you a faithful companion, a Steel Defender. You can summon it freely and give it commands in battle
Deals Force damage to the target.
When attacking with a magical weapon, you use your Intelligence for your Attack and Damage rolls instead of your Strength or Dexterity.

You've learn new ways to channel arcane energy to harm or heal. When you hit a target with a magic weapon attack, you can channel magical energy through the strike to deal an extra 2d6 Force damage to the target or to restoring 2d6 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> to a creature or construct you can see.
You can use this energy a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

You can deal Force damage to a target you've hit during this turn.
Expends 1 use of Arcane Jolt.

Choose one creature or object you can see. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring Hit Points to it.
Expends 1 use of Arcane Jolt.
The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the Steel Defender.
You achieved a profound understanding of how to use and create consumable items useful in combat. You can expend Salvaged Elements to craft them.

Magically extract useful alchemical elements to craft consumable items useful in combat or rare ingredients with your Alchemical Adept or Mastery magic. Certain items might require more units to craft.
You have magically extracted useful elements to craft consumable items and ingredients. Certain items might require more units to craft.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Requires 2 units of Salvaged Elements
Useful elements have been extracted. Might cause health issues or structural damage.
You've learned to store spells into scrolls. The magic lasts until a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, and you can create a number of scrolls equal to your Intelligence Modifier.
You've gained the ability to imbue mundane items with certain magical infusions, turning those objects into magic items.
You've learned how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects.

You've gained the ability to come up with solutions under pressure. When you or another creature you can see makes an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag> or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to add a bonus to the roll.
Spend Infusion Slots to unlock a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag>.
The Right Tool for the Job
You've learned how to produce exactly the tool you need: you can magically create thieves tools, a trap disarmimg kit, or a shovel.
This infusion gives a +1 bonus to the <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armor Class</LSTag> of a piece of armor or shield. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.

The target creature gains a +1 bonus to spell <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and spell <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DCs</LSTag>. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.
The target weapon becomes magical and grants a +1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls made with it. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class.
Infusion: Boots of the Winding Path

You can infuse a pair of boots allowing the wearer to increase their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1] and don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>.
The target weapon becomes magical and grants a +1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls made with it. It sheds a bright light.
You can infuse a weapon to grant a + 1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.
Infuse a weapon with magic, granting a + 1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack.

Infuse a ranged weapon with magic, granting a +1 bonus to Attack and Damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it, allowing to attack twice per turn. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target. The attacks become faster when you reach 10th level in this class.

While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Acid Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Cold Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Fire Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Force Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Lightning Ddamage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Necrotic Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Poison Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Psychic Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Radiant Damage.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistant</LSTag> to Thunder Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Acid Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Cold Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Force Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Lightning Ddamage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Necrotic Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Poison Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Psychic Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Radiant Damage.
While wearing this armor, a creature has <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Thunder Damage.
<LSTag Type="Image" Info="Warning"/> Using it twice will create a brief portal to the Astral Plane

You learned how to infuse your backpack with magical energy to transform it into a Bag of Holding that allows you to place items in an extradimensional space, greatly increasing the amount of items it can carry and disregarding weight. The Bag of Holding won't work in the Astral Plane. Using this infusion twice or placing the Bag of Holding inside another extradimensional space instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened.
You can shoot your ranged weapon twice at the same target.

You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special homunculus that serves you. You determine the homunculus's appearance. The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands.
Summon a cat-shaped homunculus that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Distract_Cat_Summon">Meow</LSTag> to distract your enemies.
Summon a crab-shaped homunculus that can slow enemies with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CripplingPinch_Crab_Summon">Crippling Pinch</LSTag>.
Summon a frog-shaped homunculus who can spread its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bufotoxin_Frog_Summon">Bufotoxin</LSTag> to enemies.
Summon a rat-shaped homunculus with an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Rat_Summon">Infectious Bite</LSTag>.
Summon a raven-shaped homunculus that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RendVision_RavenFamiliar_Summon">Blind</LSTag> enemies with its beak.
Summon a spider-shaped homunculus with a poisonous <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_TinySpider_Familiar">Bite</LSTag>.
Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic items. Each item will consume an Infusion Slot and will disappear at <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
This magic circlet enables its wearer to read minds. Unlocks the ability to read minds and predict the next moves.
These boots allow their wearer to fly. Fly quick. Fly safe.

You learn how to infuse your armor with arcane magic, allowing its wearer move faster and use Force attacks. Once per turn you can attack using Force blasts and area attacks, and all your weapon attacks deal additional Force damage.
You use the propulstion from your armor to deal a devastating attack with your weapon.
You can channel magic through both of your gauntlets and emit Force projectiles.
Your metallurgical pursuits have led to you making armor a conduit for your magic. As an action, you can turn a suit of armor you are wearing into Arcane Armor.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Heavy Armour.
You design your armor to be in the front line of conflict
You customize your armor for subtle undertakings.

Your Arcane Armor gains additional benefits based on its model.
Rebuild after levelup

Guardian: When a creature you can see attacks an ally nearby, you can use your reaction to magically force the creature to make a Strength Saving Throw against your spell save DC, pulling the creature toward you to an unoccupied space and dealing damage in the process.
Infiltrator: Any creature that takes lightning damage from your Lightning Launcher glimmers with magical light until the start of your next turn. It has disadvantage on attack rolls against you and takes an extra 1d6 lightning damage from your attacks.
Your right gauntlet is imbued with energy.

Each of the armor's gauntlets counts as a simple melee weapon while you aren't holding anything in it, and it deals Thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the gauntlet has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn, as the armor magically emits a distracting pulse when the creature attacks someone else.
Your left gauntlet is imbued with energy.

Each of the armor's gauntlets counts as a simple melee weapon while you aren't holding anything in it, and it deals Thunder damage on a hit. A creature hit by the gauntlet has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you until the start of your next turn, as the armor magically emits a distracting pulse when the creature attacks someone else.
This device can be added on top of gauntlets (or bare hands) to make Thunder Gauntlets. Each of them counts as a simple melee weapon while you aren't holding anything else.
As a bonus action, you can gain temporary hit points.
You can emit lightnings from your hands. Once on each of your turns when you hit a creature with it, you can deal an extra Lightning damage to that target.
Your walking speed increases by 1.5 meters.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Stealth <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>. If the armor normally imposes disadvantage on such checks, the advantage and disadvantage cancel each other, as normal.
You can use a reaction to pull a creature that attacks an ally nearby, preventing that attack.
Creatures you hit with Lightning Launcher glimmer with magical light and have Disadvantage on attack rolls and take extra damage from your Lightning Launcher.

Creatures you hit with Lightning Launcher glimmer with magical light and have Disadvantage on attack rolls and take extra damage from your Lightning Launcher. You additionally gain Advantage against them.
Gain a +1 bonus to damage when you attack or cast a spell while holding a magical weapon.
Gain a +1 bonus to damage when you attack or cast a spell while holding a magical weapon. You ignore all class and race requirements when using an item.
Gain a +2 bonus to damage when you attack or cast a spell while holding a magical weapon.

Gain a +1 bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> if you're holding a magic or infused weapon. When you posses a replicated magic item, if you're reduced to 0 hit points but not killed out-right, you can use your reaction causing you to drop to 1 hit point instead of 0.

You have been exposed to so many chemicals that they pose little risk to you, and you can use them to quickly end certain ailments. Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> you can cast Greater Restoration and Heal without expending a Spell Slot. You also get resistance to Poison damage and Acid damage, as well as immunity to being poisoned.

The benefits gained from your Perfected Armor improve further: your Guardian reaction now additionally deals damage, while your Lightning Launcher now deals 1d6 extra damage and gives you advantage against the hit creature.
You're a master at forming well-defended emplacements using Eldritch Cannon: you can now summon two of them with the same action.

Your Arcane Jolt and steel defender become more powerful: the extra damage and the healing of your Arcane Jolt both increase to 4d6; whenever your steel defender uses its Deflect Attack, the attacker takes Force damage.
